thread.title: Engg student dies as bus hits car
thread.title_full: Engg student dies as bus hits car

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Engg student dies as bus hits car
text:
Tribune News Service
Chandigarh, September 4
An engineering student of a Ludhiana-based college was killed while three other students, including two girls, were injured when their car was hit by an HRTC bus after they took a left turn at the ITI light point, Industrial Area, last night. The deceased has been identified as Aaftaab Chawla, a third-semester student of computer science and engineering, while those injured are Shaminder, also a third-semester student of computer science and engineering, Shilpa, a third-semester student of electrical engineering, and Shruti Jain, a fifth-semester student of information and technology (IT). All of them are students of Guru Nanak Dev Engineering College, Ludhiana. Sources said the car was on its way towards the Transport Chowk light point from Tribune Chowk. The bus that was on its way to Shimla. “On reaching the ITI light point, Shaminder realised that they had to take a left turn and suddenly turned the car towards the left side. The bus coming from the rear side hit the car and dragged it for a few metres,” said the sources. The left portion of the car was completely damaged. All injured were rushed to the Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH), Sector 32, where Aaftaab succumbed to his injuries during treatment. The other three are undergoing treatment and are stated to be out of danger. Aaftaab was a resident of Ludhiana. Shaminder is a resident of Ludhiana while Shilpa hails from Shimla and Shruti Jain is from Ahmedgarh. The victims had left Ludhiana late last evening without informing anyone. Shaminder was driving the car. The bus driver, Pawan Saini, was arrested and the bus impounded. A case against the bus driver has been registered at the Industrial Area police station.
